metadata.Title: CVE-2021-21193 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
Use after free in Blink in Google Chrome prior to 89.0.4389.90 allowed aremote attacker to potentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted HTMLpage.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-21193` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 89.0.4389.82-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 89.0.4389.82-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 89.0.4389.82-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 89.0.4389.82-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 89.0.4389.82-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '89.0.4389.82-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
